org.jetel.data

Class DataField

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jetel.data.DataField
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<java.lang.Object>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DataFieldImpl, DataFieldWithInvalidState

    public abstract class DataField
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<java.lang.Object>
    An interface that represents data field and its value. Note: this abstract class cannot be 'interfaced' due backward compatibility on byte code level
    Since:
    March 26, 2002
    See Also:
    OtherClasses, Serialized Form

      • duplicate

        public abstract DataField duplicate()
        Creates deep copy of existing field.
        Returns:
        new Field (exact copy of current field)

      • copyFrom

        @Deprecated
public abstract void copyFrom(DataField fieldFrom)
        Deprecated. use setValue(DataField) instead
        Sets current field's value from DataField passed as argument
        Parameters:
        fieldFrom - DataField from which to get the value

      • setValue

        public abstract void setValue(java.lang.Object _value)
        An operation that sets value of the data field. The given object is never persisted in this data field. The method implementation should do deep copy of the given object everytime.
        Parameters:
        _value - The new Value value
        Since:

      • setValue

        public abstract void setValue(DataField fromField)
        An operation that sets value of the data field from another data field.
        Parameters:
        _value - data field for getting value

      • setToDefaultValue

        public abstract void setToDefaultValue()
        An operation that sets value of the data field to default value. If default value is not preset, tries to set field value to null.
        Throws:
        BadDataFormatException - Description of the Exception

      • setNull

        public abstract void setNull(boolean isNull)
        Sets the Null value indicator/status. If passed-in value is True, then the field's internal value is set to NULL. The nullability of the field is checked and if the NULL value is not permitted, the BadDataFormatException is thrown.
        Parameters:
        isNull - The new Null value
        Since:
        September 16, 2002

      • reset

        public abstract void reset()
        An operation which sets/resets field to its initial value (just after it was created by JVM) - it varies depending on type of field.
        Nullable fields are set to NULL, non-nullable are zeroed, if they have default value defined, then default value is assigned.

      • getValue

        public abstract java.lang.Object getValue()
        Returns the internal value of the data field. If field's value is deemed to be NULL (isNull() return true) then the returned value is NULL. Otherwise the internal value is converted to appropriate object representation and returned.
        Returns:
        The Value value
        Since:

      • getValueDuplicate

        public abstract java.lang.Object getValueDuplicate()
        Returns the duplicate of the internal value of the data field. If field's value is deemed to be NULL (isNull() return true) then the returned value is NULL. Otherwise the duplicate of the internal value is converted to appropriate object representation and returned.
        Returns:
        The Value value
        Since:

      • getType

        @Deprecated
public abstract char getType()
        Deprecated. use getMetadata() and DataFieldMetadata.getDataType() instead
        Returns type of the field (String, Numeric, Date, etc.)
        Returns:
        The Type value
        Since:

      • getMetadata

        public abstract DataFieldMetadata getMetadata()
        Returns metadata associated with the data field
        Returns:
        The Metadata value
        Since:

      • isNull

        public abstract boolean isNull()
        Checks the field value for being NULL.
        Returns:
        True if the data field's internal value is deemed to be NULL otherwise false;
        Since:
        September 16, 2002

      • toByteBuffer

        public abstract int toByteBuffer(CloverBuffer dataBuffer,
               java.nio.charset.CharsetEncoder encoder)
                          throws java.nio.charset.CharacterCodingException
        Encode the field's value into ByteBuffer. The numeric value is encoded as a string representation.
        Parameters:
        encoder - Charset encoder which could be used to encode characters
        dataBuffer - Description of the Parameter
        Returns:
        number of written characters for string based fields ((DataFieldMetadata.isByteBased() == false); byte based fields return 0
        Throws:
        java.nio.charset.CharacterCodingException - Description of the Exception
        Since:
        October 31, 2002

      • toByteBuffer

        public abstract int toByteBuffer(CloverBuffer dataBuffer,
               java.nio.charset.CharsetEncoder encoder,
               int maxLength)
                          throws java.nio.charset.CharacterCodingException
        Encode the field's value into ByteBuffer. The numeric value is encoded as a string representation.
        Parameters:
        dataBuffer - buffer where the field's value is written
        encoder - encoder which is used for string to byte conversion
        maxLength - for string based fields (DataFieldMetadata.isByteBased() == false) maximum number of character written to output buffer; byte based fields can ignore this parameter
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.nio.charset.CharacterCodingException

      • equals

        public abstract boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        Checks whether two DataField objects are equal. Both fiels should be of the same type. If they are not, ClassCastException is thrown.
        Two datafields where each is flagged as to be NULL (isNull() returns true) are deemed NOT equal.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        obj - Description of Parameter
        Returns:
        Description of the Returned Value
        Since:
        September 16, 2002

      • hashCode

        public abstract int hashCode()
        Answers hash code for this field, obeying general principle: field1.equals(field2) == true => field1.hashCode() == field2.hashCode()
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class java.lang.Object

      • compareTo

        public abstract int compareTo(java.lang.Object obj)
        Compares two fields and returs -1,0,1 depending on result of comparison. Both fiels should be of the same type. If they are not, ClassCastException is thrown.
        When comparing fields where one or both are NULL (isNull() returns true), the result of comparison is that if obj is NULL the result is 1, if this.value (value of this field) is NULL, the result is -1;
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<java.lang.Object>
        Parameters:
        obj - Description of the Parameter
        Returns:
        Description of the Return Value

      • getSizeSerialized

        public abstract int getSizeSerialized()
        Gets the actual size of field (in bytes).
        How many bytes are required for field serialization
        Returns:
        The size in bytes
